titleproper.value: Ed Leffingwell Jack Smith Curatorial Files<lb/>1962-2010 (Bulk 1993-1998)<lb/> <num>MSS.380</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2017-05-19T13:57:38</date>

unittitle.value: Ed Leffingwell Jack Smith Curatorial Files

extent.value: (2 Record Cartons, 1 Media Box, Seven Oversize Folders)

abstract.value: The Edward Leffingwell Jack Smith Curatorial Files include correspondence, manuscripts, clippings and audio recordings associated with Leffingwell’s organization of the exhibition “Jack Smith: Flaming Creature” at P.S. 1 (New York) and associated printed matter, including material created by Jack Smith.

p.value: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

Published citations should take the
following form:<lb/><lb/>
Identification of item,  date (if known); Ed Leffingwell Jack Smith Curatorial Files; MSS 380; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
The collection was donated to NYU's Fales Library & Special Collections by Ed Leffingwell in 2013, and transferred directly from Leffingwell's apartment to the Library.

Sources:<lb/>
Venant, Elizabeth. “New Muni Director a Man With a Mission.” <emph render="italic">Los Angeles Times</emph>, December 8, 1988.<lb/>
Muchnic, Suzanne. "Shake-Up at Municipal Art Gallery." <emph render="italic">Los Angeles Times</emph>, July 8, 1992. <lb/>
Cotter, Holland. “P.S. 1 Review/Art; All Over the Lot (The Back Lot, Too).” <emph render="italic">The New York Times</emph>, October 31, 1997.<lb/>
<emph render="italic">Flaming Creature: Jack Smith, His Amazing Life and Times</emph>. editor Edward Leffingwell. London: Serpent's Tail Books, 1997. <lb/>
Smith, Jack. <emph render="italic">Wait for Me at the Bottom of the Pool</emph>. editor Edward Leffingwell. New York: High Risk,  1997. <lb/>
<emph render="italic">Art in America</emph> (1995-2012)

Series III contains audio material recorded onto cassette tapes, including archival material of Smith’s rehearsals, performances, and interviews as well as interviews conducted by Leffingwell. The third subseries contains a variety of material, including additional Smith recordings, stock audio and recordings of radio advertisements, albums of commercially distributed music, and a recording of a Jack Smith memorial.

subject.value: Art -- Exhibitions -- New York (State) -- New York

dsc.value:
Series I: Jack Smith ResearchScope and Content

Series I contains correspondence between Jack Smith and his contemporaries as well as follow-up from Leffingwell, copies of notebooks and scripts written by Smith, flyers and posters advertising Smith performances and screenings, interviews with Smith from periodicals or transcribed by Leffingwell, articles about Smith written by critics, journalists and fellow artists, and some contextual information, including Smith’s censorship and accusations of obscenity.

Hoberman1984-1997, undated15Gregory Markopoulos1964-199616Jonas Mekas (& Anthology Film Archive)1965-199717Irving Rosenthal1967-1988, undated18Jack Smith: Censorship [1 of 2]1964-1995, undated19Jack Smith: Censorship [2 of 2]1964-1995, undated110Jack Smith: Clash of the Brassiere Goddessesundated111Jack Smith: Correspondence1963-1996, undated112Jack Smith: Films (No President & Buzzards Over Baghdad)1967-1997, undated113Jack Smith: in Brazil1967-1995, undated114Jack Smith: in Italy1977-1982, undated115Jack Smith: Interviews [1 of 3]1964-1997, undated116Jack Smith: Interviews [2 of 3]1964-1997, undated117Jack Smith: Interviews [3 of 3]1964-1997, undated118Jack Smith: Notebook ("Brassieres For Men")undated119Jack Smith: Notebook ("Rip Torn Press Release")undated120Jack Smith: Photocopies1965-1998, undated121Jack Smith: Poster Copies1963-1987, undated122Jack Smith: The Secret of Rented Island1976-1997, undated123Jack Smith: Titles, scripts, etc.1963-1987, undated124Jack Smith: Writings [1 of 5]1964-1994, undated125Jack Smith: Writings [2 of 5]1964-1974, undated126Jack Smith: Writings [3 of 5]1965-1986, undated127Jack Smith: Writings [4 of 5]1964-1992, undated128Jack Smith: Writings [5 of 5]1981-1997, undated129Susan Sontag (Michael Moon)1964-1995130Jerry Tartaglia1995-1997131Ronald Tavel [1 of 2]1966-1999, undated132Ronald Tavel [2 of 2]1996-1998, undated133Ron Vawter ("Roy Cohn/Jack Smith")1992-1995134Andy Warhol1993, undated135Robert Wilson1965-1997, undated136Marian Zazeela/LaMonte Young1962-1997, undated137Series II: Leffingwell Correspondence & WritingScope and Content

Series II contains material related to Leffingwell's organization of “Jack Smith: Flaming Creature,” including an annotated bibliography, a checklist of the archival material assembled for the exhibition, Leffingwell’s correspondence with other artists and critics, drafts of material Leffingwell wrote for the exhibition and its associated publications, and newspaper clippings of the show’s reviews, as well as some material relating to subsequent Smith exhibitions.

Access copies for some materials are available by appointment for reading room viewing and listening only. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

Scope and Content

Series III contains audio material recorded onto cassette tapes, including archival material of Smith’s rehearsals, performances, and interviews as well as interviews conducted by Leffingwell. The third subseries contains a variety of material, including additional Smith recordings, stock audio and recordings of radio advertisements, albums of commercially distributed music, and a recording of a Jack Smith memorial.
